page.title: 05THE SUN CENTRE, RHYL
page.content: The Sun Centre, opened by Stuart Hall in 1980, cost Â£4,250,000 when it should only have cost Â£1,250,000. There is a heated pool with waves and something more adventurous is the surfing pool which is Europe's first indoor surfing pool. If you want to relax there is a choice of lying on a sunbed or sitting at a table with a drink as there is a bar with anything from orange squash to spirits. If you want to look down on things go up in a cable car which travels around the roof of the building. For the children there is a dragon slide, elephant slide, octopus slide and a bumpy slide. Even the smallest children can enjoy themselves as there is a small pool with imitation animals for them to climb over.
